body.head.byline: By VIVIAN S. TOY; With Valerie Cotsalas, Suzanne Hamlin and Antoinette Martin

abstract.p: Sampling of housing on market in New York City metropolitan area; photos (M)

block.p: Parsippany Colonial $639,500
NEW JERSEY: 10 Woodstone Road

A 35-year-old colonial with a two-story addition, four bedrooms, two baths and two half baths, a large studio with cathedral ceiling, a renovated kitchen, a family room and a finished basement. Ruth and Allan Lipnick (owners), (973) 540-9044, (973) 214-3735
TAXES: $9,373.07 a year
PROS: The house has loads of living and storage space, and oversized Pella windows throughout the first floor.
CONS: The backyard is small. The master bathroom could use updating.
Gowanus Duplex $1,249,000
BROOKLYN: 262 Bond Street (near DeGraw Street)

One of two condos in a converted warehouse, a loftlike 1,639-square-foot duplex with one bedroom, one and a half baths, roof deck and interior courtyard. Patrick Brennan, the Corcoran Group (718) 369-8792; www.corcoran.com.
COMMON CHARGE: $227 a month; taxes: $221 a month
PROS: In a fast-developing neighborhood a block from the Gowanus Canal, the building has received an Energy Star rating for its use of efficient mechanicals and sustainable and recycled materials.
CONS: Another bath and bedrooms could be added on the second floor, but it would be at the buyer's expense.
Upper East Side One-Bedroom $799,000
MANHATTAN: 370 East 76th Street (at First Avenue), #B302
A one-bedroom, one-bath co-op with a balcony in a doorman building. Eloise Johnson, Halstead Property (212) 381-3224; www.halstead.com
MAINTENANCE: $941 a month

PROS: This apartment is filled with built-ins, including bookcases in the living room, two walls of closets in the bedroom and a well-designed home office. The maintenance includes gas and electricity. The building has a rooftop outdoor pool.
CONS: The kitchen and bathroom are a bit dated.
TriBeCa Loft $1,775,000
MANHATTAN: 474 Greenwich Street (between Watts and Canal Streets), #6W

A two-bedroom, one-bath co-op with keyed elevator access, central air-conditioning, a fireplace and a roof deck. Paddington Zwiggard (212) 906-0539, Mara Papasoff (212) 906-0511, Brown Harris Stevens; www.brownharrisstevens.com
MAINTENANCE: $1,653 a month

PROS: The huge bathroom has a whirlpool bath, a separate shower and a washer and dryer. The large roof deck provides a view of the Hudson River. The open living and kitchen area has a working fireplace and hand-carved antique Chinese doors.
CONS: The loft is filled with windows, but most face onto another building. Heavy traffic to the Holland Tunnel is a part of the neighborhood.
Colonial on Former Estate $899,000
NASSAU: 80 Powell Place, Farmingdale

A restored and updated 1933 brick colonial with five bedrooms, three and a half baths and central air-conditioning in the upscale Lenox Hills section. Arched windows, restored pecan floors and a covered porch with brick arches give the house a warm grandeur and charm. Liz Schumann, Coldwell Banker (516) 241-6617; www.cbmoves.com
TAXES: $11,672 a year

PROS: The price was recently reduced from $1.1 million. The house is within walking distance of the train and a short drive from the Black Course in Bethpage State Park, where the U.S. Open will be played again in 2009.
CONS: The kitchen cabinets need updating; the backyard is small.
